title: Act 2012 (No. 31 of 2012), and with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: (a) These Regulations may be cited as the Microenterprise Loan Fund
text_raw:
1. 

(a) These Regulations may be cited as the Microenterprise Loan Fund 

Scheme (Amendment) Regulations 2024. 

(b) The Microenterprise Loan Fund Scheme 2015 (S.I. No. 
393/2015), and these Regulations are to be construed together as 
one. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 (a) regulation may cited microenterprise loan fund scheme (amendment) regulation 2024 (b) microenterprise loan fund scheme 2015 (s.i no 393 2015) regulation construed together one interpretation

title: Act 2012 (No. 31 of 2012), and with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: In these Regulations-
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations- 

“Principal Regulations” means the Microenterprise Loan Fund Scheme 2015 
(S.I. No. 393/2015) as amended. 

“Regulations of 2020” means the Microenterprise Loan Fund Scheme 
(Amendment) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 78 of 2020) 

Amendment of Regulation 5.1.2 of the Principal Regulations – Purpose of Loan
text_norm: 2 regulations- principal regulation mean microenterprise loan fund scheme 2015 (s.i no 393 2015) amended regulation 2020 mean microenterprise loan fund scheme (amendment) regulation 2020 (s.i no 78 2020) amendment regulation 5.1.2 principal regulation - purpose loan

title: Act 2012 (No. 31 of 2012), and with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 3. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Regulation
text_raw: 3. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Regulation

title: Act 2012 (No. 31 of 2012), and with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 5.1.2 the following:
text_raw:
5.1.2 the following: 

“5.1.2 Purpose of Loan 

Loans will be provided for business start-up costs, expansion costs 
and working capital.” 

Amendment of Regulation 5.1.3 of the Principal Regulations –Permissible Loan 
Values
text_norm: 5.1.2 following 5.1.2 purpose loan loan provided business start-up cost expansion cost working capital amendment regulation 5.1.3 principal regulation -permissible loan value

title: Act 2012 (No. 31 of 2012), and with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 4. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Regulation
text_raw: 4. The Principal Regulations are amended by substituting for Regulation

title: Act 2012 (No. 31 of 2012), and with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 5.1.3 the following:
text_raw:
5.1.3 the following: 

“5.1.3 Permissible Loan Values 

Loans will be for amounts up to €50,000.” 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 30th August, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Revocation of the Regulations of 2020
text_norm: 5.1.3 following 5.1.3 permissible loan value loan amount eur50 000 notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 30th august 2024 revocation regulation 2020

title: Act 2012 (No. 31 of 2012), and with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 5. The Regulations of 2020 are hereby revoked.
text_raw:
5. The Regulations of 2020 are hereby revoked. 

[423] 3 

The Minister for Finance consents to the foregoing amendments to the 
Microenterprise Loan Fund Scheme, 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

23 August, 2024. 

JACK CHAMBERS, 

Minister for Finance. 

The Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery, and 
Reform consents to the foregoing amendments to the Microenterprise Loan Fund 
Scheme, 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 August, 2024. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 August, 2024. 

PETER BURKE, 

Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [423]

title: Act 2012 (No. 31 of 2012), and with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Instrument increases Microfinance Ireland permissible loan value from 
€25,000 to €50,000 for microenterprises. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [423] 5
